I know the correct way to cite something from others work and how to write an academic article in general.

ethics
I learned more about Chris and Melanie's role's as advisors and how to approach some of the intricacies of being a PhD student.
Practical knowledge about research and the ethics issues in research.
learned about how to cite correctly, utilize plentiful university resources and even career plan.
The most practical class is the Endnote learning. Other sessions like authorship, funding, etc. are also very useful.
This course gave stressed the importance of ethic in research by providing reminders of ethical practice and discussing the nuances of ethical dilemmas.
research ethics, academic norms, Endnote
Processes for funding, publication, and academic honesty.

ethics and academic integrity

Ethics in research. Publication process and stages in different journals. Concept of plagiarism and examples.

I knew more about research ethics and how to become a better researcher.
academic integrity and some tips for a better graduate education.
Quantitative skills majorly
the course is around lunchtime but without food
good

I liked the topics covered in the course overall. I wish there was a greater focus on what to do in tough situations and how to report inappropriate behavior etc. I know that was covered in orientation but it would have been more comforting coming from out dept advisors that we actually interact with.
The course provides us profound knowledge about how to do research properly and efficiently. If really need me to point out a weakness, that will be no free lunch! ;)

The course only met once a week and had minimal requirements, so it was nice to be able to go listen. However, I believe that holding a course from 12-1 is not an optimal time because everyone seemed to be distracted.

Strengths: This course can help students know research ethics in one semester.
Weakness: It should not be mandatory for students already with research backgrounds.
It is a necessary course to have. Very helpful.
it's useful!
